title: Beyond the Lens: Uncovering the Cartoonist Legacy of Filmmaker Govindan Aravindan
content:
Govindan Aravindan, the renowned Malayali filmmaker known for his contributions to Indian New Wave cinema, had a hidden talent: cartooning. 

Aravindan's 13-year-long cartoon serial, "Cheriya Manushyarum Valiya Lokavum," (Little Men and the Big World) ran in the Mathrubhumi Weekly, showcasing his storytelling prowess through the medium of cartoons. 

EP Unny, a leading cartoonist, will shed light on Aravindan's cartooning career at a seminar in Thiruvananthapuram, marking the 25th death anniversary of the filmmaker. Unny highlights how Aravindan's cartooning was innovative, incorporating elements like ageing characters and cinematic sequencing, making it a precursor to graphic novels.

While Aravindan's influence on mainstream Malayalam cartooning is minimal, his legacy as a multi-faceted artist lives on through his films and inspires contemporary filmmakers like Rajeev Vijayaraghavan.
author: Nandini Ramnath
